s.text: Due to the unavoidable tentativeness in identification, while analyzing parasite diversity we used two strategies.
Using an L shaped wire loop with a 6 mm diameter loop the contents of the surface layer were transferred on to a slide for observation.

The estimated parasite densities in some of the tigers in the Mudumalai wildlife sanctuary were up to 1500 flukes in the lungs or a total of 30 meter length of tapeworms in the intestine [ 17 ] . Parasites in such a large amount can certainly have considerable impact on the health, behaviour and reproductive success of individuals.
Besides a number of questions regarding individual health, prey choice, territorial behaviour, movement patterns and reproductive success in relation to parasite loads can be worth investigating.

The estimated parasite densities in some of the tigers in the Mudumalai wildlife sanctuary were up to 1500 flukes in the lungs or a total of 30 meter length of tapeworms in the intestine [ 17 ] . Parasites in such a large amount can certainly have considerable impact on the health, behaviour and reproductive success of individuals.
Besides a number of questions regarding individual health, prey choice, territorial behaviour, movement patterns and reproductive success in relation to parasite loads can be worth investigating.
Of particular interest are the clusters, the "territories" occupied by each of the clusters and the apparently higher parasite loads of the presumably "non-territorial" ones.

The cluster 13 consisted of between 50 to 350 Diphyllobothrium eggs and occasional ascarid eggs and the cluster 14 consisted of a large number (500-4000) of Diphyllobothrium eggs with a low to moderate number of Taenia and Ascarid or lungworm.

Since the frequency of locating fresh scats is usually high in most of the tiger areas, parasite compositions in scats can be a useful tool in monitoring tigers particularly in areas where tiger sighting is rare.
The consistency of this pattern in the three unrelated situations is curious but as yet we do not know the factors that make the parasite variance scale with the square of the mean.

TATR supports a diverse mammalian assemblage including tiger ( Panthera tigris ), leopard ( Panthera pardus ), hyena ( Hyaena hyaena ), sloth bear ( Melursus ursinus ), dhole ( Cuon alpinus ), jackal ( Canis aureus ) and jungle cat ( Felis chaus ) as the carnivores, the common langur ( Semnopithecus entellus ) is the most numerous primate and the ungulates include barking deer ( Muntiacus muntjak ), gaur ( Bos gaurus ), sambar ( Cervus unicolor ), chital ( Axis axis ), wild boar ( Sus scrofa ), nilgai ( Boselapheus tragocamelus ) and chousinga ( Tetracerus quadricornis ).
